definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to

sentences.english: The receptionist books the room for the arriving guest.
sentences.chinese: 前臺接待員爲來客預訂房間。

sentences.english: After a 30-minute wait, a frazzled receptionist showed up.
sentences.chinese: 經過30分鐘的等待，一個疲憊不堪的接待員出現了。

sentences.english: Hua, the receptionist, is discussing their schedule with them.
sentences.chinese: 接待員小華正在和他們討論日程安排。

sentences.english: Receptionist: Yes, only within the effective period.
sentences.chinese: 接待員:可以的，但只能在有效期內。

sentences.english: She gave the desk clerk her AmEx card.
sentences.chinese: 她把美國運通卡遞給接待員。

sentences.english: Inom the receptionist here! welcome to our hotel.
sentences.chinese: 我是這兒的接待員，接待離開我們酒店。

sentences.english: A clerk in her local town hall, Ms.
sentences.chinese: 費瑞格夫人是當地市政廳的一名接待員。

sentences.english: Receptionist: Yes, madam, your friend is very lucky.
sentences.chinese: 接待員:嗯，女士，你朋友很幸運。

sentences.english: R:We must announce visitors to our guests.
sentences.chinese: 接待員:我們必須要通知我們的客人。

sentences.english: The personnel manager has been casting about for somebody who can act as receptionist.
sentences.chinese: 人事部經理一直在到處物色接待員的人選。

sentences.english: He can't even get a job as a greeter at Wal-Mart.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至連沃爾瑪的接待員工作也找不到。

sentences.english: No patients sit in his waiting room. No receptionist answers the telephone.
sentences.chinese: 沒有病人在候診室裏，也沒有接電話的前臺接待員。

sentences.english: Buy the office receptionist flowers just to say, “Thank you.”
sentences.chinese: 爲前臺接待員買一些花，說聲“謝謝”。

sentences.english: The  receptionist received a  receipt from the  receiver.
sentences.chinese: 接待員收到一份來自接收者的收據。

definition: abbr. for 侍應生|侍应生[shi4 ying4 sheng1]
higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
civilian post (as opposed to military)/civil service/administration
